sections.title: FAQs
sections.description: Here are some frequently asked questions, to solve all your problems.

faqItems.question: Is this just another agent framework?
faqItems.answer: No. Frameworks help you build agents. decoCMS is the operating layer that makes tool access, permissions, audit trails, and observability consistent—so agents can actually survive production.

faqItems.question: Do we need MCP to use this?
faqItems.answer: If you're serious about interoperability, yes—MCP is quickly becoming the shared "tool access protocol." decoCMS is built around MCP because governance and scale require a standard control plane.

faqItems.question: How does this help with "shadow AI"?
faqItems.answer: By moving control from "policy docs" into runtime: SSO/IAM, access policies, audit logs, and cost attribution become enforced automatically instead of negotiated app-by-app.

faqItems.question: How do permissions work in practice?
faqItems.answer: You define who can call what—by user/team/app/agent—at the Mesh layer. So "marketing agent" can read CRM fields but can't write to prod systems unless explicitly allowed.

faqItems.question: Can I self-host?
faqItems.answer: Yes. The point is portability: run on Kubernetes, on-prem, or in your cloud—while keeping the same governed endpoint and operational model.

faqItems.question: How does this reduce cost, not increase it?
faqItems.answer: Mesh-level runtime strategies help avoid "tool spam" and bloated contexts, route calls intelligently, and give you cost attribution per team/app—so you can actually set limits and optimize.

faqItems.question: What's the fastest path to value?
faqItems.answer: Start with one high-impact workflow where governance matters (support, sales ops, internal approvals). Use Mesh to standardize access + logging, then use Studio to turn what works into reusable assets.
